view

Class ClientView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • view.ClientView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientView
extends java.lang.Thread
    View for playing the game in Multiplayer mode.
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Jan-Jaap van Raffe and Wouter Bos

    • Method Detail

      • getClient

        public Client getClient()
        Returns the corresponding client of this view.
        Returns:
        view's corresponding client

      • getClientName

        public java.lang.String getClientName()
        Asks the Client for his name.
        Returns:
        name of the client.

      • getIP

        public java.lang.String getIP()
        Asks the Client for the IP-address he wants to connect to.
        Returns:
        IP-address filled in by the client.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Asks the Client for the port he wants to connect to.
        Returns:
        port filled in by the client.

      • printGameEnd

        public void printGameEnd(java.lang.String message)
        When a game ends, prints the name of the winner, if there is one. Else, prints a message about the draw.
        Parameters:
        message - End game command from the server.

      • serverDisconnected

        public void serverDisconnected()
        Prints that the server has disconnected and that the Client has to start the program again.

      • invitesSended

        public void invitesSended()
        Prints that the Server has send invites to everyone in the lobby. Also prints that the server waits for a reaction, or an arbitrary but suitable invite to accept.

      • showHint

        public void showHint(int hint)
        Shows a hint for a move.
        Parameters:
        hint - the hint

      • showBoard

        public void showBoard(Board board)
        Shows the current board.
        Parameters:
        board - the current board

      • showGameStart

        public void showGameStart(Board board,
                          java.lang.String opp,
                          int number)
        Prints the start of a game. First prints the opponent's name, then the board and last but not least, the player number of this client.
        Parameters:
        board - The board to print
        opp - opponent's name
        number - player number of this client

      • printLobby

        public void printLobby(java.lang.String lobby)
        Prints the current lobby of the server.
        Parameters:
        lobby - the lobby

      • printString

        public void printString(java.lang.String string)
        Prints an arbitrary String.
        Parameters:
        string - string to be printed

      • connected

        public void connected()
        Prints a successful-connection-message.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs a ClientView thread. In this version, nothing is done with it. Program can be expanded by adding a chat feature. Then you need this method. :-)
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
